description: The Imagga API is a set of image understanding and analysis technologies available as a web service that allows you to automate the process of analyzing, organizing and searching through large collections of unstructured images.

blocks.name: tagImageById
blocks.description: By sending image content id to the tagImageById endpoint you can get a list of many automatically suggested textual tags.

args.name: key
args.info: API key.

args.name: secret
args.info: API secret.

args.name: contentId
args.info: You can also directly send image files for auto-tagging by uploading them to our uploadImage endpoint and then providing the received content identifiers via this parameter.You can provide up to 5 id.

args.name: showTagInformation
args.info: Whether to return some additional information about each of the tags or not.

args.name: language
args.info: See all available languages in README.You can apply this parameter multiple times.Example - en.

args.name: limit
args.info: Limits the number of tags in the result to the number you set.

blocks.name: tagImageByUrl
blocks.description: By sending image url to the tagImageByUrl endpoint you can get a list of many automatically suggested textual tags.

args.name: imageUrl
args.info: Image URL to perform auto-tagging on. You can provide up to 5 urls for processing by sending multiple url parameters.

args.name: showTagInformation
args.info: Whether to return some additional information about each of the tags or not.

args.name: language
args.info: See all available languages in README.You can apply this parameter multiple times.Example - en.

args.name: limit
args.info: Limits the number of tags in the result to the number you set.

args.name: key
args.info: API key.

args.name: secret
args.info: API secret.

blocks.name: getAllCategorizers
blocks.description: Get a list of all available categorizers for you.

args.name: key
args.info: API key.

args.name: secret
args.info: API secret.

args.name: key
args.info: API key.

args.name: secret
args.info: API secret.

args.name: contentId
args.info: Image content id.Obtained with uploadImage endpoits.

blocks.name: uploadImage
blocks.description: Using the uploadImage endpoint you can upload a file (image or video) for processing by one of the other Imagga API endpoint.

args.name: key
args.info: API key.

args.name: secret
args.info: API secret.

args.name: imageFile
args.info: Uploaded image.

blocks.name: getImageCategoriesByUrl
blocks.description: By sending image url and categorizerId from getAllCategoriez endpoint to the this endpoint you can get a list of many categorizers.

args.name: key
args.info: API key.

args.name: secret
args.info: API secret.

args.name: categorizerId
args.info: The categorizer id.

args.name: imageUrl
args.info: URL of an image to submit for categorization. You can provide up to 10 urls for processing by sending multiple url parameters.

args.name: language
args.info: See all available languages in README.You can apply this parameter multiple times.Example - en.

blocks.name: getImageCategoriesById
blocks.description: By sending image content id and categorizerId from getAllCategoriez endpoint to the this endpoint you can get a list of many categorizers.

args.name: key
args.info: API key.

args.name: secret
args.info: API secret.

args.name: categorizerId
args.info: The categorizer id.

args.name: contentId
args.info: You can also directly send image files for categorization by uploading the images to our uploadImage endpoint.Example - en.

args.name: language
args.info: See all available languages in README.You can apply this parameter multiple times.

blocks.name: getCropOptionsByUrl
blocks.description: The technology behind this endpoint analyzes the pixel content of each given image url in order to find the most “visually important” areas in the image.

args.name: key
args.info: API key.

args.name: secret
args.info: API secret.

args.name: imageUrl
args.info: A URL of the image to send for smart-cropping analysis. You can provide as many url parameters as you like in order to send multiple images for smart-cropping analysis.

args.name: resolutionPair
args.info: Resolution pair in the form (width)x(height) where ‘x’ is just the small letter x. You can provide several resolutions just by providing several resolution parameters as with the urls.

args.name: scaling
args.info: Whether the cropping coordinates should exactly match the requested resolutions or just preserve their aspect ratios and let you resize the cropped image later.

blocks.name: getCropOptionsById
blocks.description: The technology behind this endpoint analyzes the pixel content of each given image content id in order to find the most “visually important” areas in the image.

args.name: key
args.info: API key.

args.name: secret
args.info: API secret.

args.name: contentId
args.info: You can also directly send image files for smart-cropping analysis by uploading them to our /content endpoint and then providing the received content identifier via this parameter.

args.name: resolutionPair
args.info: Resolution pair in the form (width)x(height) where ‘x’ is just the small letter x. You can provide several resolutions just by providing several resolution parameters as with the urls.

args.name: scaling
args.info: Whether the cropping coordinates should exactly match the requested resolutions or just preserve their aspect ratios and let you resize the cropped image later.

blocks.name: getImageColorExtractionByUrl
blocks.description: Analyse and extract the predominant colors from one or several url images.

args.name: key
args.info: API key.

args.name: secret
args.info: API secret.

args.name: imageUrl
args.info: Image URL to perform color extraction on. You can provide as many url parameters as you like in order to send multiple images for color extraction.

args.name: extractOverallColors
args.info: Specify whether the overall image colors should be extracted.

args.name: extractObjectColors
args.info: Specify if the service should try to extract object and non-object (a.k.a. foreground and background) colors separately.

blocks.name: getImageColorExtractionById
blocks.description: Analyse and extract the predominant colors from one or several images content id.

args.name: key
args.info: API key.

args.name: secret
args.info: API secret.

args.name: contentId
args.info: You can also send actual image files for color extraction. This is achieved by uploading the images to our uploadImage endpoint.You can provide up to 10 ids.

args.name: extractOverallColors
args.info: Specify whether the overall image colors should be extracted.

args.name: extractObjectColors
args.info: Specify if the service should try to extract object and non-object (a.k.a. foreground and background) colors separately.
